title: Execute bash commands from the start menu
body: I don't know how easy it would be to implement, but it would be interesting if we could execute bash commands directly from the start menu. They could be invoked with a special keyword like "sudo" - for example, writing "sudo ssh root@my_server_ip" on the Windows start menu would open the bash shell and connect to the respective server.

comments.body: Isn't this now possible - at least with builds 195xx-ish or newer?  I think there is a CMD.EXE command that can sub-invoke lxrun, which starts bash or another Linux command.  If my understanding is correct, it would be very helpful for a WSL/Ubuntu/bash engineer to add this info to this request, and mark it as potentially fixed!
